name: Philadelphia Marriott West

reviews.text: These folks are great! Aside from from the incredibly comfortable beds, spacious & clean rooms, the staff is top notch. They offered Philly soft pretzels with mustard upon my arrival on a Friday afternoon....now THAT'S a Philly welcome! Ever staff member I encountered were professional, friendly and most courteous. Location is great...adjacent to I-76 and I-476. VERY competitive rates, too. It's well worth considering this property if you are headed their way. Quiet, too. A real credit to Marriott.
reviews.title: A Chain Hotel With a Very Personal Feel

reviews.text: Once you get over the "Ryanair-style" naming of the hotel (it is emphatically not anywhere near down-town Philly), it is actually quite conveniently located for business meetings in the Upper Merion/King of Prussia area and not too far from the airport, which is 30-45 minutes away depending on traffic.
reviews.title: Surprisingly good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel looks to me to be standard-issue 90s US business hotel, so don't expect any real character to the place (although the now seemingly retro carpet is quite fun!). Having said that, it is clean and well-maintained and my room had a comfortable bed, good (if rather expensive) WiFi and a decent shower so for a business trip, it was perfectly fine.
reviews.title: Poor Value, Nice Property

reviews.text: I had room service one night - standard-issue club sandwich - and it was pretty average. Only do it if you are very hungry and don't have time to go out somewhere.
reviews.title: Horrible policies for cancellation
Great Hotel.....but....
reviews.text: Definitely one of those places where if I had to stay again, I wouldn't mind, but equally I wouldn't go out of my way to stay there.

I stayed here for one night before my wedding (I got married at Riverbend Environmental Education Center in Gladwyne, which is about 5 minutes from the hotel) and was pleased with the accommodations. The room (a regular "guest room") was affordable, clean, comfortable, spacious, with good quality furnishings and cozy decor and was the perfect location to prepare for the wedding. In fact, it seemed to be a popular place to hold a wedding itself, as the hotel was abuzz with what appeared to be several weddings/events. The bed was very comfortable, with soft linens and good pillows and parking was easy (you use your hotel card to leave the garage). I would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Good one night stay before wedding
Be Warned!
reviews.text: Be warned. We stayed in this hotel to visit our daughter attending Villanova back in September and an I Pad was taken from our room with little or no cooperation from Marriott and no refund. Marriott personell told us they had their own security who would coordinate with the police, which is not the case. We reluctantly stayed there again in November and my expensive leather coat was stolen from the room (and mysteriously recovered and returned once we got the police involved.)
If you have something taken from this or any other Hotel insist contact the local police.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: We stayed at the Marriott for two nights in conjunction with a wedding we were attending nearby. The hotel had rooms blocked for the wedding guests. The price was right and included free parking. The satff was very accomodating. The facilities were great including an adequately outfitted gym and indoor pool. It had everything we needed. Also, on premises was a Shula's 324. We made god use of after the wedding reception. Recommend it. for sure.
reviews.title: Meeting Planners Beware

reviews.text: This hotel will indeed nickel and dime you for every last dollar you have.
reviews.title: Consistently Good With Nice Extra Touches!

reviews.text: Stayed a weeknight for business travel. The rooms have been renovated and are equipped with all amenities you'd expect - new flat screen tvs, comfortable bed. My only reservation is that this hotel is hard to get to from the freeway. I went down to the restaurant and had dinner at the bar, and while the food was expensive for value received, as a solo female traveler I appreciate not having to go out for dinner by myself, so I'm willing to pay if the food is good. For business travel, I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Beautiful New Room on Concierge Floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although I wasn't crazy paying $12 to self-park my car in a suburban hotel, the remainder of my brief stay at this hotel was excellent. The bed was the most comfortable I have enjoyed in a hotel and I visit 20 or so hotels in the Marriott chain per year. The room was very clean and was decent size.
reviews.title: Highly recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel will nickle and dime you to death!!!!! There is an extra fee for daily parking. There is an extra fee for internet access. The prices in their restaurant / bar are incredibly expensive and only serve adequate food.
reviews.title: Vile experience - Avoid at all costs go to King of Prussia instead

reviews.text: We were there for a wedding and received a good rate. We decided to extend our trip two days we were charged ALMOST TRIPLE the wedding rate PER NIGHT for the extra two days!!!!
reviews.title: $13 for Parking per night
Not good for business travel
reviews.text: The purpose of this Marriott is to make money at the expense of the traveler. Avoid it at all costs and go to King of Prussia for better hotels that are a better value with no hidden costs.

We stayed here for a wedding one night. Got a great deal on Priceline, only $50 a night. The room was nice, the front desk staff was accommodating, the valets and bellhops were very nice and helpful. One complaint: we needed help with our luggage on arrival, and there was no one available to help, and even the luggage carts were not around for some reason.
reviews.title: No Complaints

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's a WaWa across the street to buy drinks and incidentals, and a McDonald's down the block. The hotel staff will tell you that there's nowhere to park except in their lot for $12 a day or $20 valet, but we parked by the McDonald's for free with no problems.
reviews.title: May 22,23,24, 2009

reviews.text: The hotel is a bit difficult to access from I-476. Visitors really need to pay attention to the directions and the road signs in order to get to it. It is a fair distance and a bit out of the way from King of Prussia Mall and other shopping locations.
reviews.title: Amazingly quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed with a wedding party during Memorial Day weekend. There were a number of other wedding parties also staying at the hotel, and it apparently is quite popular with locals as a wedding facility. We had a great rate of $70/night for the room that was blocked for the wedding party. Very great rate compared to some of the varying rates that other regular guests were receiving.
reviews.title: Another quality Marriott

reviews.text: This hotel has a lot of add-on charges. $12 daily fee for parking at their facility, $20 if you want valet. However, the valet service merely parks your vehicle with everyone elses. No separate area. 2 things about the parking garage. The spaces are very narrow, and the clearance height is only 6 feet, 2 inches throughout the garage. It is adequately lit, though, with security occassionally driving through. There is no free internet service. The charge to access the internet is $13 per day.
reviews.title: Nice Marriott, just don't eat at Shula's downstairs

aka: Philadelphia Marriott West Hotel West Conshohocken
description: The Philadelphia Marriott West is a full-service hotel in West Conshohocken located between downtown Philadelphia and the airport, featuring wedding sites, meeting facilities, and more.
